meanings.definition: To remove sacred or holy status from something.
meanings.sent1: The ancient ritual was desanctifying the sacred ground.
meanings.sent2: The villagers were desanctifying the old temple to build a new community center.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children joked about desanctifying the teacher's desk by placing a rubber chicken on it.
meanings.sent4: The storm's destructive force seemed to be desanctifying the once peaceful forest.
meanings.sent5: The artist's graffiti desanctified the pristine white wall, turning it into a canvas of rebellion.

meanings.definition: To make something no longer considered holy or sacred.
meanings.sent1: The new law was desanctifying the traditional customs of the tribe.
meanings.sent2: The modern society was desanctifying ancient relics by turning them into tourist attractions.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about desanctifying the sacred cow by teaching it to dance.
meanings.sent4: The passage of time seemed to be desanctifying the once revered traditions.
meanings.sent5: The explorer's discovery of the hidden tomb desanctified the myths surrounding the ancient ruler.
